report_title: Field Service Management Software in the US
executive_summary: Field Service Management (FSM) software helps businesses coordinate and dispatch field service workers. The bulk of clients include manufacturers, telecommunications companies, wholesalers and retailers. Even so, FSM software is used by a multitude of markets. Most clients are small or medium-size businesses that exhibit a boost in operational efficiency through FSM solutions. Larger companies often have in-house products that handle similar issues, limiting the need for FSM software.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Increasing Dependence on Technological Business Solutions
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The ongoing transition of businesses entering the digital sphere has made field service management software increasingly attractive. Investing in such software can lead to substantial savings in operational costs as it enhances efficiency and optimizes the use of employee time.

The applicability of FSM software across a wide range of markets creates opportunities for new players to emerge. Aspiring tech companies can disrupt the market by delivering value-added features or providing niche, tailor-made services. This has led to a massive influx of new companies popping up.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Hunt for Top-Notch Talent Continues
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: After a product has been developed, production and purchase costs remain low since the publisher can sell the same software at no additional charge. Even so, skilled software engineers are needed for development.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Downstream Demand is Bolstered by New Initiatives
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The major users of FSM software are companies that manufacture, sell or service equipment and systems like heating, ventilation and air conditioning equipment, wind turbines and industrial machinery companies that frequently dispatch technicians to job sites.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: The Impact of Machine Learning in Field Service Management
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The integration of machine learning (ML) and artificial intelligence (AI) into field service management (FSM) software implies new possibilities for efficiency in route optimization and trend prediction.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Exploring Mobile Apps as Versatile Alternatives to Traditional FSM Software
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Field service operations that do not require the intricacies of full-scale FSM software can leverage simple, readily available mobile applications for streamlined communication, massively reducing expenses for end-users.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Emerging Trends Include the Entry of New Players and Market Consolidation
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Driven by the availability of generous financial backing, the FSM industry continues to witness an influx of innovative startups looking to establish their niche market. Venture capital firms are always looking for the next hottest thing and will help fund innovative FSM entrants.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: A Recovering Economy Pushes Growth Forward
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: While much of the latter half of the current period was met with inflationary concerns, these issues are set to simmer down throughout the outlook period as the Federal Reserve continues to reel in inflation. In November 2023, the Federal Reserve left interest rates steady as inflation was tapering off.

industry_definition: Companies in this industry develop and publish software designed to assist in the tracking and dispatching of field service technicians and the dissemination of appropriate data to those technicians. Software developed by this industry can track inventory and help automate fleet dispatch assignments.
key_trends: Small- and medium-sized companies are more willing to upgrade their technology systems because of the benefits they can provide. This has spurred the need for field service management software.
New companies are rapidly entering the industry because of the endless possibilities. Smaller companies can carve out a niche with various different markets and customers available.
New entrants have plenty of options for private assistance. Venture capital firms provide direct funding for new start-ups they believe can succeed.

Private investment in computers and software continues to expand as businesses look to leverage technology in their day-to-day operations. Field service management software can help companies run more efficiently.

Online shopping has skyrocketed following the pandemic. Wholesalers and retailers are rapidly relying on field service management software to keep track of their operations and ensure everything is running smoothly.
Developers are incorporating machine learning into their software. Optimizing routes and creating plans to ensure the most efficient deployment of workers continues to improve.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Companies that manufacture and service equipment for production companies represent the largest market for FSM developers. Businesses that install, repair and maintain industrial equipment (think industrial appliances, heavy machinery, robotics, construction equipment, paper, food service production and packaging machinery) use FSM to assist with their in-field logistical needs. This also includes manufacturers that offer product installation, field service repair, depot repair and preventive maintenance or inspection services. While manufacturing took a hit because of the pandemic, the sector is up and running again and expanding.

The telecommunications and utility sectors maintain, upgrade and repair large amounts of network infrastructure. As internet services expand, companies in this market hire more workers to keep up with demand. Telecom and utility companies are turning to Field Service Management (FSM) to help them achieve efficiency gains wherever possible throughout their maintenance and service operations.

Wholesalers and retailers are rapidly adopting FSM software to help manage product installations, field service repairs, depot repairs and scheduled maintenance. FSM software is used by technicians working for wholesalers and retailers to access product information and customer data, record service activities and issue receipts. E-commerce is growing faster than ever and FSM helps manage the ever-growing pool of online shoppers.

FSM software is used for commercial, industrial and residential construction projects. FSM ensures deliveries and installations of materials are made on time. Large-scale contractors rely on FSM software to help meet deadlines and prevent construction delays. It also manages workforce logistics and tracks when properly licensed and certified labor resources are scheduled to work on job sites.

products_and_services.product_description: The software makes scheduling and routing easier than ever. Field service management software (FSM) enables businesses to schedule, route and dispatch mobile workers more efficiently. Nearly a quarter of revenue is generated through scheduling and routing. FSM software collects real-time data from current locations to estimate arrival time and help pick the most efficient way to reach a destination.

FSM solutions help customers and businesses interact. The software helps company technicians and customers stay updated on the progress of their service requests. It also enables businesses to share up-to-date quotes, order forms and invoices between companies and clients. Real-time capabilities allow for changes like price modifications and unexpected expenses.

Service providers use FSM to track work orders and contact technicians to carry out specific aspects of the task. A quarter of revenue is generated through work orders. Work orders can change at any given moment. FSM software enables businesses to make and approve changes to a work order.

Invoicing and accounting FSM software allows businesses to manage on-site estimates, invoicing, payments, billing and other transactional services. Data collected from on-site technicians is integrated directly into other accounting software. The FSM software also allows technicians to provide quotes on the spot for special work order adjustments. This helps save clients and customers time, bolstering efficiency.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Inventory, Logistics and Parts Planning Services
products_and_services.product_description: FSM systems help businesses manage their spare parts inventory and order new parts when necessary. It also helps with logistics. FSM software also accounts for resources and automatically orders parts when required. This helps companies operate more efficiently and never run out of spare parts.

tier_2_suppliers: Data Processing & Hosting Services in the US
Intellectual Property Licensing in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Other markets find value in FSM software
demand_determinants.determinant_description: FSM software is used in various industries, including insurance, finance, facilities management, oil and gas, transportation and logistics. FSM software will play a vital role in helping companies provide efficient service as these markets expand. As new niche industries emerge or expand, many of them will rely on FSM software to maximize their production and output.

business_locations.location_description: The West has been a hotbed of software innovation for years, hosting more than a quarter of field service management developers and publishers. California is home to Silicon Valley, one of the world's largest tech hubs. California leads the country in FSM publishing, with almost a quarter of operators in that region. The region has some of the best technology in the country, allowing companies to recruit skilled employees more efficiently.

While the Southeast does not carry the same name recognition as the West or Mid-Atlantic, it benefits from a massive labor pool, which is critical for an industry defined by its workforce. The high cost of living in other regions has forced many companies to move to low-cost states like Florida. Many states in the Southwest offer tax-breaks for employees and businesses, which is attractive to both parties.

The Mid-Atlantic region is also a technology hub, hosting many large tech companies and new emerging start-ups. The region has many urban cities which attract talented employees. New York acts as a labor hub for the entire region, drawing in younger talent that costs less to hire. It is home to many prestigious universities. Operating in Washington DC allows companies to gain access to many government clients across various fields.

regulations_points.regulation_description: US copyright laws protect copyright owners from the unauthorized reproduction, adaptation, performance, display or distribution of copyright protected works. The Fair Use Doctrine in US copyright law limits the extent to which a citizen may use a quote from copyrighted material depending on the nature of the use (including commercial purpose, nonprofit and educational). The Copyright Term Extension Act of 1998 extended US copyright to 70 years beyond the life of the author. The Digital Millennium Copyright Act (DMCA) of 1998 criminalized some cases of copyright infringement and prohibits the manufacture and distribution of services designed for the sole purpose of undermining technology used to protect copyrighted works. The No Electronic Theft Act of 1997 permits criminal prosecution of individuals that commit computer program infringements, even when no monetary profit or commercial gain is derived from the activity.

Various levels of regulation were implemented because of the COVID-19 pandemic, varying from state to state. This led many companies to transition to a predominantly "remote office" work setup in 2020 to ensure employee health and safety and to comply with various state regulations requiring office closures during the pandemic. As the pandemic ended, many companies continued their work-from-home or hybrid office policies.

barriers_points.barrier_description: Companies require skilled software engineers, developers and marketers to create the best product possible and deliver it to their customers.

basis_points.basis_title: New companies join every year but big-name technology operators remain at the top
basis_points.basis_description: While new companies join every year, the market's big-name technology operators remain at the top.

basis_points.basis_title: Larger companies consolidate smaller developers before they pose a threat
basis_points.basis_description: Larger companies will consolidate smaller developers before they pose a threat.

basis_points.basis_title: Competition from other business analytical software
basis_points.basis_description: Developers contend with other business analytical software.

basis_points.basis_title: Price points and functionality lead consumers to choose different services
basis_points.basis_description: Other types of software may have similar properties, but price points and functionality may lead consumers to choose a different service.

concentration_points.concentration_title: The large tech companies have their stakes
concentration_points.concentration_description: The four largest companies control more than two-fifths of the industry.
Larger companies buy out and acquire up-and-coming entrants with a proven track record.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Economies of scale help larger companies
concentration_points.concentration_description: These companies have the capability to snag away key talent by enticing them with higher wages. Having achieved economies of scale makes it easier to develop and distribute software.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Research and Development Costs Make Up the Bulk of Miscellaneous Costs
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Additional costs remain the second-largest expense for software developers, accounting for almost a quarter of revenue. Research and development costs make up a sizeable expense for software development. Creating new products requires much trial and error to arrive at a marketable solution. Developers continuously expand their R&D expenditure to ensure their products are a notch above the competition. Past investments and a growing customer pool have eased costs down.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Companies require skilled software engineers, developers and marketers to create the best product possible and deliver it to their customers.

volatility_points.volatility_description: Using field service management software can improve operational efficiency. Companies are more willing to spend money on the latest software because the returns are high. Even so, amid inflationary concerns or economic uncertainty, many clients may scale back on software purchases, constraining revenue growth.

With field service management becoming more popular, start-ups are popping up left and right to enter the market. Private funding is available through venture capital firms and investors placing bets on up-and-coming developers and publishers. New entrants often take massive hits to revenue and profitability in the early stages of development as they seek to gain and retain clients.

FAQs.question: How have changes in consumers' electronic usage habits changed your operations?
FAQs.answer: The rise of smartphones has given downstream buyers more access to industry services. However, a small threat remains as mobile apps have provided ways to bypass the industry for similar services. Companies had to shift to remote work due to health and safety and to comply with various state regulations requiring office closures during the pandemic.

FAQs.question: Industry Assistance
FAQs.answer: Private Funding is Available: Developers and publishers receive funding through private sources. Venture capital groups are a significant source for start-ups. After gaining the attention of a venture capital company, developers will present their business proposal and a stake in company ownership in exchange for large lumps of cash to build out development resources.

FAQs.question: How reliant is your company on advertising revenue?
FAQs.answer: Generally speaking, the industry generates revenue through the sale of its services. However, large companies have proved that (with enough user data) ad-based revenue models can work well, which may entice some companies to one day go that route.

FAQs.question: Has your company been exposed to rising wages in recent years?
FAQs.answer: Changes in technology has made it more affordable for downstream buyers to afford services provided by the industry. For example, company-provided hardware was once required to use industry services. Today, technicians simply can use their smartphones.

FAQs.question: Does the impact of large technology companies affect your operational costs?
FAQs.answer: This industry is small and its two largest players are also among the largest companies in the world. How Oracle and SAP operate will impact smaller players, who must adjust in order to remain competitive.

FAQs.question: Has your company been able to keep up with rapidly changing digital interfaces?
FAQs.answer: It is vital to keep current with changing digital interfaces. For example, while laptops were once the go-to mobile communication tool, smartphones now are. Companies must adapt or customers will move on.

FAQs.question: Has your company adequately prepared to address the increased security risks posed by digital data storage?
FAQs.answer: Industry companies develop applications that contain sensitive data on people, companies and proprietary technology. Vendors must ensure data is secure, or else risk losing customers to competitors.

FAQs.question: Are you or your competitors facing scrutiny from antitrust litigation?
FAQs.answer: Many companies in this industry are small and need not worry about antitrust laws.

FAQs.question: How does your company stay ahead of new regulations like FCC policy changes?
FAQs.answer: There are not many regulations that directly impact this industry. Operators should, however, look out for changes in net neutrality and other competition-based regulations which may change.

FAQs.question: Do you have any big projects on the horizon that will require capital financing?
FAQs.answer: Most industry companies are able to fund without significant capital finance needs, as companies do not produce tangible goods.

FAQs.question: How does your company's profit margins compare to your main competitors?
FAQs.answer: The industry's average profit margins is inflated based on the market share and high profit margins of Oracle and SAP. Small companies should not compare themselves to these two global heavyweights, as they have a diversified portfolio of technology offerings.

FAQs.question: How much of your production is devoted to premium products? Do you spend on marketing to position your products as top-quality?
FAQs.answer: Ease of use is an important design element for field service management software because it has such a large and diverse user base.

FAQs.question: How do you attract and retain qualified staff? What qualifications must your staff have? Do you have a high turnover rate?
FAQs.answer: Software development is a highly specialized skill set in high demand from a variety of industries. Attracting and keeping highly skilled software developers is key to continued business success in this industry.

FAQs.question: What products and services do you offer? Does your company offer package deals?
FAQs.answer: Field service management software vendors that offer related products and services (e.g. database software packages, support and update programs) are more successful than vendors that do not provide those services.
